laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Liver function tests and alpha-1 antitrypsin phenotype and level
laboratory_examinations.findings: Patient 1: Normal alpha-1 antitrypsin phenotype (MM) and level (1.93 g/L), Patient 2: Normal alpha-1 antitrypsin phenotype (MM) and level (1.22 g/L)

Patient 1: FEV1/FVC = 53%; FEV1 = 2.77 L (73% predicted); FVC = 5.19 L (109% predicted); residual volume = 3.02 L (135% predicted); DLCO = 3.96 mmol/min/kPa (37% predicted). Patient 2: Initially similar to brother, later FEV1 = 0.91 L (25% predicted); DLCO = 3.41 mmol/min/kPa (32% predicted) after 6 years.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient 1 showed a steady decline in lung function over 13 years. Patient 2 experienced deterioration leading to exercise limitation at 20 yards.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Both patients had normal urinary cadmium levels (<0.3 mcg/g creatinine).
